title: What are Tangent Lines ?
text: A tangent line is a line that shares one and only one point \((x,y)\) with another non-linear function. When we say sharing, we mean the following, $$ \text{Given any two functions, $f(x)$ and $g(x)$, we say that $f(x)$ and $g(x)$ share a given point $(p,q)$ if and only if $f(p) = g(p) = q$} $$ In regards to finding the equation of a tangent line, we are usually given a non-linear function \(f(x)\) and a point \((p,q)\) and we are asked to find \(g(x)\) which is the function of the tangent line. If you are wondering what tangent lines are used for, that's a great question and a good place to start. Tangent lines help us find the rate of change at a specific point for a curve. A real world example of this would be dropping a ball or some sort of object from the top of a building and calculating its velocity at a certain point during its descent.
